channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Four-day week may be considered a sign of failure, England councils told
item.description: Local government secretary writes to town halls warning them against ‘part-time work for full-time pay’ The secretary for local government has written...

item.title: Ryanair fined €256m over ‘abusive strategy’ to limit ticket sales by online travel agencies
item.description: Italy’s competition authority says Irish airline implemented technical obstacles to force sales through its own website Business live – latest updates...

item.title: Russian attacks kill three and cut power to freezing Ukrainian regions
item.description: Four-year-old child among those killed in drone and missile assault targeting energy infrastructure amid cold snap A massive Russian drone and missile...

item.title: Non-crime hate incident recording system for police ‘not fit for purpose’ – UK politics live
item.description: Police chiefs to call for non-crime hate incidents to be scrapped and replaced with a ‘common sense’ checklist system Wes Streeting, the health secret...

item.title: Former Tory councillor in court accused of drugging and raping ex-wife
item.description: Philip Young appears at Swindon magistrates court charged with 56 offences relating to 13-year period A former Tory councillor has appeared in court c...

item.title: Boaters stranded for Christmas after canal collapse
item.description: One couple say they had decorated the boat for Christmas but would now spend it in a hotel.

item.title: Scrap non-crime hate incidents, police leaders to recommend
item.description: College of Policing chair says a "sensible" new approach is needed, focused on the most serious incidents.

item.title: 'We didn't get it right' - Key sorry for Ashes display
item.description: Director of cricket Rob Key says he is "gutted, disappointed and sorry" regarding England's dismal Ashes performance - the series having been lost wit...

item.title: England to investigate reports of players drinking excessively during Ashes break
item.description: England will look into reports of players drinking excessively during a break from the Ashes series in Noosa, says director of cricket Rob Key.

item.title: Husband in court charged with repeatedly drugging and raping ex-wife
item.description: Former councillor Philip Young is one of six men accused of multiple offences against Joanne Young.
